content.explanation:
Advanced factoring techniques are essential for:

• Solving complex quadratic equations
• Simplifying rational expressions
• Finding x-intercepts of polynomial graphs
• Calculus applications (finding critical points)
• Engineering and physics problem-solving
content.example: In physics, when modeling projectile motion, you might need to factor 4.9t² + 20t - 15 = 0 to find when an object hits the ground.
content.key_point: These skills build the foundation for advanced mathematics and real-world problem-solving.
